MS MCQs

    Get started with workflows in Dynamics 365 for Customer Engagement

    »

    1. A workflow process is deactivated. What happens to workflows currently in process at the time of deactivation?

      Current workflows enter a waiting status and can be resumed later.

      Asynchronous workflows are paused, changes made by synchronous workflows are rolled back.

      Current workflows are canceled.

      Nothing. Workflows previously triggered will run to completion or cancelation.


    2. Which type of workflow runs independent of other workflows and plugins?

      Real-Time workflow

      Background workflow

      Parent workflow

      Child workflow


    3. For a workflow with a scope of business unit, which record field indicates the records that will be exposed to the workflow?

      Owner

      Territory

      Business unit

      Scope


    4. When an asynchronous workflow is triggered by a change in data, whose security roles are used to give the security context?

      The owner of the record.

      The owner of the workflow.

      The system administrator.

      The user modifying the record.


    5. You have a workflow with a wait condition that waits for a specific status reason value. What step would you use to ensure that the process does not wait indefinitely?

      Synchronous Wait step using process Start time property.

      Change Status step to update status reason value to the one matching wait condition.

      Parallel Wait step using Timeout property of the process.

      You cannot simultaneously wait on multiple conditions.
